paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Predominantly male, mean age at symptom onset 56.6 years.
patients.phenotype: Symptomatic patients with various phenotypes including predominantly cardiac and neurologic.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The majority of symptomatic patients were male (70.8%) with a mean (standard deviation [SD]) age at symptom onset of 56.6 (17.9) years.

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is known to destabilize the TTR protein, leading to amyloid fibril formation.
assays: Neuropathy Impairment Score in the Lower Limbs (NIS-LL)

variants.population_frequency: V30M remains the most prevalent genotype in Europe (62.2%), South America (78.6%), and Japan (74.2%).
variants.additional_notes: The V30M variant is the most studied and prevalent in ATTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: V30M remained the most prevalent genotype in Europe (62.2%), South America (78.6%), and Japan (74.2%).
Asymptomatic gene carriers were 58.5% female with a mean age at enrollment of 41.9 years (SD 15.5).

tables_processed.table_caption: Demographics of symptomatic patients according to genotype category
Demographics of asymptomatic gene carriers according to genotype category

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
